abstract.para: Storage pools are locations (like directories or partitions) where VM images are stored.

step.para: Navigate to Virtual machines and click the Storage pools link.
In the Create storage pool page, select the Connection as either System or User session.
Specify a storage pool name and select the storage pool type from the drop-down list.
For storage pool type, File system directory, specify the target path as the path on the host's file system.
For storage pool type, Network file system,

listitem.para: In Target path, specify the path on the host's file system.
In Host, specify the host name.
In Source path, specify the the directory on the server being exported.
In Target path, specify the path on the host's file system.
In Host, specify the host name.
In Source path, specify the iSCSI target IQN.

step.para: For storage pool type, Physical disk device,

listitem.para: In Target path, specify the path on the host's file system.
In Source path, specify the physical disk device on host.
Select the format from the drop-down list.

step.para: For storage pool type, Pre-formatted block device,

listitem.para: In Target path, specify the path on the host's file system.
In Source path, specify the path to the file.
Select the format from the drop-down list.

step.para: For storage pool type, iSCSI direct target,

listitem.para: In Host name, specify the name of the host.
In Source path, specify the iSCSI target IQN.
In Initiator, specify the iSCSI initiator IQN.

step.para: To configure pool to start when host boots, select Start pool when host boots checkbox.

section.title: Managing a storage pool
section.para: To perform any administration task on an existing storage pool, perform the following steps:

step.para: Navigate to the Virtual machines page and select the Networks link.
Here you can perform the following actions with existing storage pools:

listitem.para: Click the Activate button next to the required storage pool.
Click the Deactivate button next to the storage pool name.
In the three-dot menu, select Delete.
